processText:
Wheelchairs

Wheelchairs can be found in the shed behind the dining room

Where to find TubiGrip

The tubiGrip can be found in the cupboard within the Physio room itself

Shower Chair Location:

Shower chairs can be found in the shed behind the dining room

Usually the shed is kept unlocked, if you need a key ask maintenance Jeff.

processTitle: How to Complete a Falls Review
processText:
How to complete a Falls review:

  • Review resident for any injuries

  • Review past falls for trends or clusters

  • Assess if any changes need to be made to falls prevention strategies, mobility, planned care activities etc.

  • Write a progress note with findings/ assessment/ plan

  • Update the Mobility careplan

    • If no changes, just write post-fall r/v

  • Update Maintaining a safe environment careplan

  • Update DEMMI/ Mobility and function assessment

  • Handover to RN/CM/Nurses

Completing a DEMMI

The DEMMI is an advanced instrument for accurately measuring the mobility of older people across clinical settings.

You can fill out a form just like this found under the residents assessment tools tab - Fill out the fields and it will calculate the residents score!

processTitle: How to Update the Mobility careplan
processText:
Updating the Mobility Care Plan

  • Find the mobility careplan from within the care plans tab of the resident you would like to update

  • If this is the first time you are writing the mobility care plan simply fill out the required fields, ensuring you specify the Residents, mobility and transfer status

  • Otherwise if you are just reviewing, make any changes necessary

  • Once completed, simply press save and write a short note in the provided box

processTitle: How to update general risk assessments
processText:
Updating general risk assessment form:

  • Check the residents page to see if they have any general risk assessment forms completed in the past

  • Review necessary forms with resident if indicated

processTitle: How to Complete a Six Months Review
processText:
Completing a 6 month review:

  • Check to see when a residents review is due, ensure it is completed prior to this date

  • Read care notes, taking consideration for hospital visits, falls, adverse events, pain entries, mobility, medication over the last 6 months

  • Speak with the resident

  • Critically assess the residents capacity and how they are doing, comparing existing care plan

  • Check with clinical staff

  • Review early intervention program

Complete the following assessments:

  • Mobility and functiokn

  • Berg Balance Scale

  • DEMMI

  • Update general risk assessments related to AH or mobility
